text:
Richmond Terrace, south side, between St. Peters Place and Nicholas Street, showing St. Peters Roman Catholic School. The 2-1/2-story frame house,on the left, is the Staten Island Women's Club. The view is eastward.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
(2)
A closer view of the Staten Island Women's Club, and
St. Peters School. The view is westward.
May 2, 1928
P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - St. Peter's Place

title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - St. Peter's Place

text:
Richmond Terrace, at the S.E. corner of St. Peters Place, showing an old mansion in the Corinthian order of classical Greek architecture. It belonged to Mrs. Feiller in 1874; to Mrs. L. Neilson in 1898, and to Chas. Rosenberg in 1907. In the background appears St. Peters Roman Catholic Church.

May 2, 1928

P. L. Sperr
title: Richmond: Richmond Terrace - St. Peter's Place
